Im not saying that Pulp Fiction and Reservoir Dogs aren't, but think about all the genres that are rolled into one here. Theres love, comedy, drama, violence, crime, mafia, drugs, hollywood, and the list goes on and on. I think that it may be one of the top 5-10 best screenplays ever written. Also, aside from the writing, the casting is superb. I mean we have Christian Slater (his best role), Patricia Arquette, Dennis Hopper, Christopher Walken, Gary Oldman, Samuel Jackson, Tom Sizemore, Val Kilmer, Brad Pitt, James Gandolfini (the role that pretty much had Tony Soprano written all over it) and other great actors. When you put a lot of marquis actors in a movie, it doesnt always work out because sometimes its just too much, but in this movie, their appearances in the movie are all balanced out that it works. I mean Christopher Walken is only in the movie for about 10 minutes and in that 10 minutes, he has the most memorable scene in the movie. Same goes for Gary Oldman. Tony Scott's directing is also remarkable. All in all, if you haven't seen this movie in a while or havent at all, rent it, buy it, order it, or whatever means of movie purchase you are accostomed to, and enjoy it because i think that it is a true classic. You literally will laugh, cry, and cringe, but most importantly, you will be satisfied......10/10.

title: boy meets girl with a pinch of salt
content: this should be renamed truly superb. great idea, great cast, great music, great shots. the real strong point of this film is the music composed by hans zimmer. in terms of music composers zimmer is in a league of his own. the storyline is very typical of Tarantino with all the crime plot and gorey scenes you need. one thing that tony scott does a lot is use tilted camera angles when someone is lying on the floor. this works very well. the most famous cast members are all really in cameo roles. christopher walken only appears in one scene (a great scene with dennis hopper) and you never see val kilmar's face. gary oldman and brad pitt don't play big roles in fact brad pitt's character (a complete stoner) isn't very relevent to the story. there is only one thing that lets this film down. sometimes Christian slater talks to quietly and quickly for you to understand whats going on. other than that this is arguably better than pulp fiction.

title: Tarantino and Scott give us an instant classic
content: "True Romance" from 1993, directed by Tony Scott and written by Quentin Tarantino, is an electrifying rollercoaster of romance, violence, crime, and unforgettable characters, blending comedic moments throughout. The film stands as a bold testament to Tarantino's signature dialogue stylings, with sharp, witty exchanges that crackle with energy and reveal deep layers of each character's desires and motivations. Christian Slater delivers a career-defining performance as Clarence, a charming yet naive comic book store clerk who embarks on a passionate, violent journey to protect his beloved Alabama, played with fiery intensity by Patricia Arquette. Their whirlwind love affair, set against a backdrop of colorful, morally ambiguous characters and locations, is nothing short of mesmerizing, capturing the essence of impulsive romance in all its chaos and beauty. The star-studded supporting cast includes Dennis Hopper, Gary Oldman, Christopher Walken, Val Kilmer, James Gandolfini, and Brad Pitt, who all bring vibrant depth to the film, each performance adding to the movie's gritty charm. Scott's dynamic, layered direction, paired with Hans Zimmer's hauntingly atmospheric score, creates a perfect visual and emotional synergy, making this a thrilling, heartfelt ride that's both a homage to, and a subversion of, the classic Hollywood love story. This is a movie that transcends any single genre, and is filled with unexpected treasures to discover within. All that and so much more, makes this a very special film, and eminently rewatchable.

title: the best Tarantino movie not made by Tarantino
content: I believe that there is such a genre called 'the Tarantino movies'. They have a story which is usually a gangster story, but not necessarily. Men in the story are teenagers or they all have teenagers minds, they are addicted to comics and pulp fiction, they love cinema if cinema was invented when the action takes place, there must be a scene in a cinema theater or at least in front of a TV set in these films. Girls are gorgeous and hookers. Morality plays an important role, but is of a special kind. There is a lot of violence in this films, so well filmed that viewers know it's not true and they have fun watching it. Martial arts are the real art.Some of the Tarantino films are made by Quentin Tarantino. Some other not. 'True Romance' is not, but it's written by Tarantino, it was made 20 years ago but looks as fresh as if it was made yesterday, which shows that the genre beyond other qualities also has the one of aging nicely. It's a gangster story, it's a love story, it's a crime comedy about a young couple semi-willingly becoming murderers and unwillingly becoming drug dealers, it's a road movie, it's a movie about Hollywood. And it's fun to watch.There are so many good things in this film that I have a hard time picking which one to list. Dialogs and the musical score (Hans Zimmer - see the list of the films he composed for at IMDb and you will understand why you loved even more some of the best films in Hollywood in the last 30 years) are exquisite. Acting is stellar with the lead exception of Christian Slater which I simply cannot force myself to like. Lucky me, he is paired in the film with Patricia Arquette, and then we have Dennis Hopper, Brad Pitt, James Gandolfini, Christopher Walke, Gary Oldman ... wow ... each of them in supporting roles hard to forget.The director of this film is Tony Scott, who died last year. He was among these directors who would never get an Oscar because he just made the films that pleased the crowds. 'True Romance' is however much more than a crowd-pleaser, it may be T.Scott's best and one of the best Tarantino films ever made.

title: This film is .....
content: .... utterly contrived,ridiculously implausible and totally brilliant. Simply the best film l have ever seen; from the story, the script, the cast, the acting, the location, to the sound track it is flawless and the definition of cool. The film is considered over estimated by some, but for me it has everything; drama, comedy, tension, action and a love story, and to get caught up in the plot flaws is to lose the point of the tale. I cant add anything that hasn't already been said about the scene between Christopher Walken & Dennis Hopper but if there is a finer scene in any film, l have yet to see it.

title: Brilliant and Awkard Masterpiece
content: This is not a movie I'd expect to be widely loved. It is dark, extremely violent, unfiltered amd so politically incorrect it couldn't be made today and it's hard to believe it was made even in the early 90s.But the film was so raw and intense, it gripped anyone who ever saw it and literally hemmed any viewer into a dark nasty world full of racism, violence and desperation that was never expressed so candidly,Regardless of whether you liked it or hated it, it was unforgettable. The acting was very good, but will be immortalized by the Hopper/Walken scene and Gary Oldman holding the thin line separating caricature and character.The dialogue holds through time as some of QT's rawest and most ambitious to this day and will not be attempted again. It was fully 1990s in origin and at a time when the limit to morality was being stretched to its fullest for the first time since the 70sGreat film, but be careful who you recommend this film to.

title: It makes you laugh
content:
As Tarantino movie ( here script) all of this is great compatabile and funny.Lot of admire for director Tony Scott who created many fantastic and one of my favourite movie ( Spy Game, Man on Fire, Deja Vu,Fan, Beverly Hills Cop)
Nice plot, nice details specialy last scene in hotel room with all team- that was really cool and funny. Emilio was acting exactly like Serge from Beverly Hills cop and Alabama was laughing on couch just like another actors. They got really great fun.Lovely Brad Pitt role, Gary Oldman- just like bizzar drug dealer from Leo- profesional. Little part of Samuel L. Jackson.Hans Zimmer music. Pink cadilac. Elvis Presley and ninja stuff. All of this making nice 2hs entertainment and laughing.Marvelous piece of art. Worth seeing.

title: A hard-hitting movie with a John Woo ending even Shakespeare would love...
content: Ah, True Romance, what a truly excellent film, I don't even know where to begin. The dialogue alone is worthy of an Oscar in my opinion, from Elvis to Sonny Chiba, Sicilians and Charles Bronson, this movie has it all. Although it's not for all tastes, the main characters are a loser and an ex-call girl who somehow find each other under crazy circumstances, the story will definitely keep you watching. The ensemble is chock full of actors in roles you would never guess, Brad Pitt as a pothead, Gary Oldman as a pimp, as well as terrific performances from all. To me this movie combined some of Tony Scott's best direction and Tarantino's best writing.  To sum it up: It's a hard-hitting movie with a John Woo ending even Shakespeare would love; IT KICKED ASS.

title: A film gem
content: This film is a gem, perhaps some sort of classic. The dialogue between Christopher Walken and Dennis Hopper in  Clifford Worley's trailer is a brilliant example of screen writing and acting. It may well be superior to Tarantino's Pulp Fiction.

title: Reservoir Dogs-GOOD    Pulp Fiction-GREAT   True Romance-EXCELLENT
content: This perfect cast takes you on a rollercoaster ride from start to finish. From the small roles of Samuel L Jackson, the then UNKNOWNS Tom Sizemore&James Gandolfini, Dennis Hopper, Christopher Walken, Brad Pitt and Gary Oldman (Kim Basinger received a best supporting  actress award for her tiny role in LA CONFIDENTIAL, so how come Oldman didn't get a supporting actor award  for this film, he was AWESOME)to the main characters, Christian Slater and Patricia Arquette, this movie doesn't miss a single beat. The dialogue is superb, going from hilarious to gutwrenching and vice versa in a split second. This movie has it all, and if it sounds like I am saying it doesn't get any better than "True Romance" than you would be right, it doesn't....

title: one of the most memorable films
content: there are some films, which you may come back over the years.  You remember some scenes, or lines of dialogue when talking with friends.  This is surely one of such films.  Such a huge cast, such a nice story and a very easy flow of moments.  I truly recommend one particular scene to everyone. The scene between Dennis Hopper and Christopher Walken.  Everything about that scene is great, almost monumental moment of cinema history.  If you don't have the time to watch the whole film, which is a real pity, at least pay attention for 5 minutes to watch this scene.oh, by the way, almost forgotten, one of the top credits for this film surely goes to Tarantino.  No one else could have written this better.
